title: Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Voodoo for Peace," Reverse Side", ca. 1984
medium: Black and red marking pen, brush and red gouache(?), white color pencil/crayon (?) on white tracing paper
description: Four panel screen in form of four black figures with red belts.  Heads and torsos of each figure are composed of different geometric shapes.  Reading from left to right: figure with large circular head with arrow on top and diamond cutout on torso;  figure with rectangular head and headdress of three cans; figure with biomorphic-shaped head and three diamond cutouts on torso; figure with eliptical head and four horizontal slits on torso.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Voodoo for Peace," Reverse Side", ca. 1984.
ca. 1984. Black and red marking pen, brush and red gouache(?), white color pencil/crayon (?) on white tracing paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-107.
